item.title: US Clothes, Toy Costs Show Tariff Hit Only at Margins So Far
item.description: For all the hand-wringing about tariffs, Americans are so far experiencing limited inflation from President Donald Trump’s protectionist trade policy.
item.dc:creator: Augusta Saraiva

media:content.media:description: Shoppers browse clothing at the Polaris Fashion Place mall on Black Friday in Columbus, Ohio, US, on Friday, Nov. 24, 2023. An estimated 182 million people are planning to shop from Thanksgiving Day through Cyber Monday, the most since 2017, according to the National Retail Federation.

item.title: EU Proposes Sanctioning Two Small Chinese Banks for Russia Trade
item.description: The European Union has proposed sanctioning two small Chinese banks for helping Russia get around the bloc’s existing trade restrictions, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: China Customs officers raise a Chinese flag along the Bund in front of the Lujiazui Financial District at sunrise in Shanghai, China. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: Senate GOP Clashes With House on Food Aid Cuts in Trump Tax Bill
item.description: Senate Republicans are planning to water down House legislation that would shift as much as a quarter of the cost of federal food stamps to state governments to help pay for Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package, a key senator said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: Senator John Boozman,

item.title: Italy Delays Decision on Probe Into Chinese Influence at Pirelli
item.description: Italy is delaying a decision on whether Pirelli & C. SpA’s largest investor, state-backed Sinochem International Corp., breached rules designed to limit China’s influence over the tire manufacturer.
item.dc:creator: Daniele Lepido

media:content.media:description: An employee inspects an automobile tire at the Pirelli & Co. SpA production plant in Merlo, Argentina.

item.title: Harvard Spurns Overseas Campus as Antidote to Trump’s Ban on Foreign Students
item.description: Harvard University isn’t considering opening a foreign campus to counteract President Donald Trump’s push to block the enrollment of international students, despite an invitation from a top German culture official.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ryan

media:content.media:description: The Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts, US, on Wednesday, June 4, 2025. Harvard University won a longer-term reprieve from a Trump administration ban on enrolling international students, handing the nations oldest and richest university a victory in its battle with the White House.

item.title: EU Likely to Be at ‘Very End’ of US Trade Deals, Lutnick Says
item.description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the European Union is likely to be among the last deals that the US completes, as the administration rushes to secure tariff agreements with other trading partners.
item.dc:creator: Skylar Woodhouse

media:content.media:description: A operations at the Euromax Terminal in the Port of Rotterdam, in Rotterdam, Netherlands.

item.title: New York Joins California in Opposing Trump Using Troops in LA
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James joined California in condemning the Trump administration for deploying troops from the state’s National Guard to respond to immigration protests in Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: Madlin Mekelburg

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA - JUNE 08: Demonstrators protest outside a downtown jail in Los Angeles following two days of clashes with police during a series of immigration raids on June 08, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. Tensions in the city remain high after the Trump administration called in the National Guard against the wishes of city leaders. (Photo by Spencer Platt/Getty Images) Photographer: Spencer Platt/Getty Images North America

item.title: EU and UK Reach Deal on Gibraltar’s Post-Brexit Border Rules
item.description: The European Union reached a political agreement with the UK on the post-Brexit border arrangements for Gibraltar following talks on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Valero, Max Ramsay

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk towards the border crossing into Gibraltar from the Spanish side at La Linea de la Concepcion, Spain.

item.title: Air Force One Production Still Marred by Assembly Woes, GAO Says
item.description: Boeing Co.’s new Air Force One faces several issues including unresolved technical modifications that could further delay delivery, congressional auditors found.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Capaccio

media:content.media:description: Air Force One at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport in Phoenix, Arizona.

item.title: Trump Says China Will Ship Rare Earths in ‘Done’ Trade Deal
item.description: President Donald Trump said a trade framework with China has been completed, with Beijing supplying rare earths and magnets “UP FRONT” and the US allowing Chinese students into its colleges and universities.
item.dc:creator: Josh Wingrove, Skylar Woodhouse

item.title: Pentagon Slashes in Half Its Request for Air Force F-35s
item.description: The Air Force has cut in half its request to Congress for its signature F-35s, dealing a blow to Lockheed Martin Corp., the top US defense contractor.
item.dc:creator: Roxana Tiron, Anthony Capaccio

media:content.media:description: A US Air Force F35A fighter jet. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: Musk Says He Regrets Social Media Posts Lashing Out at Trump
item.description: Elon Musk, who served as a close adviser and confidant to President Donald Trump until a bitter public falling-out last week, issued his strongest sign of contrition yet over how he handled the rupture.
item.dc:creator: William Selway

media:content.media:description: Trump and Musk at the White House in March.

item.title: Here Are the Winners and Losers of UK’s Big Spending Shake-Up
item.description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves laid out how she’ll divide more than £600 billion ($810 billion) of annual spending between departments, capping Labour’s first year in power. The decisions will have a broad impact across the UK, where the outlays account for about a fifth of the economy.
item.dc:creator: Irina Anghel

media:content.media:description: Rachel Reeves, UK chancellor of the exchequer, outside 11 Downing Street ahead of the presentation of the spending review in London, on June 11.

item.title: Polish Premier Tusk Wins Confidence Vote After Election Loss
item.description: Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk won a vote of confidence in parliament on Wednesday after he promised to reshuffle the government in the wake of a bruising defeat of his ally in a presidential election.
item.dc:creator: Agnieszka Barteczko

media:content.media:description: Donald Tusk Photographer: Omar Marques/Getty Images

item.title: Anti-ICE Protests Spread to NYC, Chicago After LA Imposes Curfew
item.description: Protests over immigration raids stretched into a fifth night in Los Angeles and spread to other cities, including New York, Chicago and Milwaukee, prompting clashes between police and demonstrators.
item.dc:creator: Eliyahu Kamisher, Nacha Cattan, Miranda Davis

media:content.media:description: Police enforce a curfew in Los Angeles on June 10. Photographer: Mario Tama/Getty Images

item.title: Walmart US CEO Furner to Address Largest House GOP Caucus
item.description: Walmart US CEO John Furner will address a gathering of House Republicans in the Capitol on Wednesday, hours after President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with China has been completed.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Jaewon Kang

media:content.media:description: Walmart CEO John Furner

item.title: Erdogan Says Indonesia to Buy Nearly 50 Fighter Jets From Turkey
item.description: Turkey will sell 48 fighter jets to Indonesia in the coming decade, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said, as Ankara pushes to build its defense industry and increase exports of military hardware.
item.dc:creator: Firat Kozok, Selcan Hacaoglu, Ben Otto

media:content.media:description: ANKARA, TURKIYE- MAY 1: Presentation ceremony of the National Combat Aircraft KAAN on May 1, 2023 in Ankara, Türkiye. According to the President's statements, the National Combat Aircraft (MMU) or TF-X "Kaan" project, which will enter the inventory of the Turkish Armed Forces, is considered an important step in Turkey's aviation and defense industry. (Photo by Yavuz Ozden/ dia images via Getty Images)

item.title: Kirchner’s Ban From Office Marks New Chapter for Argentina
item.description: Argentina’s top court sidelined former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner from future elections, likely ushering in a new political era in South America’s second biggest economy.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Lawyers for Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, 72, requested house arrest after the former president’s corruption conviction was upheld by Argentina’s top court.

item.title: Bessent Credits Trump Policies for ‘Substantial’ CPI Improvement
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent credited President Donald Trump’s policies for a slowdown in US inflation, and said he had challenged a “decades-old status quo” on trade.
item.dc:creator: Enda Curran

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump and Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary.

item.title: European Banks With Russian Units Help Keep Natural Gas Flowing
item.description: Western banks including Raiffeisen Bank International AG that still operate units in Russia are helping some of the last European buyers of Russian pipeline gas pay for purchases after the US sanctioned Gazprombank.
item.dc:creator: Marton Eder, Ugur Yilmaz, Firat Kozok, Daniel Hornak

media:content.media:description: Pipework at a Gazprom gas site in Russia.

item.title: China Found World’s Pain Point on Trade — and Will Use It Again
item.description: For months Donald Trump pushed tariffs and trade restrictions on China to unprecedented levels, part of a strategy to force Xi Jinping into talks the US president expected would help cut the trade deficit and boost American manufacturing.
item.dc:creator: Martin Ritchie, Alberto Nardelli, Laura Curtis

media:content.media:description: NdFeB alloy strip at the Australia Strategic Materials Ltd.'s Korean Metals Plant, in the Ochang Foreign Investment Zone, in Cheongju, South Korea, on Tuesday, June 10, 2025.

item.title: Texas Governor Readies National Guard Troops Ahead of Protests
item.description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott vowed to use National Guard troops if needed to maintain order during protests against President Donald Trump this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Julie Fine

media:content.media:description: People march during an "ICE Out of Austin" demonstration in Austin, Texas, on June 9.

item.title: Bessent Says ‘We Will See’ If China Is Reliable on Trade

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary, arrives for a House Ways and Means Committee hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, June 11, 2025. Bessent credited President Donald Trump’s policies for a slowdown in US inflation, and said he had challenged a “decades-old status quo” on trade.

item.title: US-Iran Strains Show as Trump Says He’s ‘Less Confident’ on Deal
item.description: Tensions in the US-Iran nuclear talks came to the fore as President Donald Trump voiced skepticism about an agreement, while Tehran raised the prospect of attacks on American bases.
item.dc:creator: Arsalan Shahla

media:content.media:description: The reactor building at the Bushehr nuclear power plant in Bushehr, Iran, in a handout image supplied by the Iran International Photo Agency. Photographer: Iran International Photo Agency/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Tariffs Can Stay in Effect Longer, Appeals Court Says
item.description: Donald Trump can continue to enforce his global tariffs for now, a federal appeals court held in a win for the president on one of his signature economic policies.
item.dc:creator: Zoe Tillman, Erik Larson

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump Photographer: Ken Cedeno/UPI

item.title: Dollar-Obsessed Argentines Have a Newfound Love for Buying Gold
item.description: Gold is winning over the hearts of Argentines, a nation once almost irrationally devoted to the dollar.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Olivera Doll

media:content.media:description: A box with gold bars at Banco Piano in Buenos Aires. The bank is one of a few institutions that sell physical gold with a certificate of origin and a top purity rating.

item.title: Kosovo Willing to Take In Third-Country Deportees from US
item.description: Kosovo is willing to temporarily host migrants deported from the US, the government in Pristina said, as US President Donald Trump’s administration searches for countries to take in third-country deportees.
item.dc:creator: Gresa Kraja

media:content.media:description: Kosovo's national flag displayed in front of a store in Pristina.

item.title: Slovak Premier Threatens to Block EU Sanctions Against Russia
item.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico threatened to block the European Union’s new sanctions package against the Kremlin unless the bloc comes up with a way to address the potential loss of Russian energy supplies.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Hornak

media:content.media:description: Robert Fico Photographer: Alessia Pierdomenico/Bloomberg

item.title: Trade War Adds Risk to Irish Financial System, Regulator Warns
item.description: Rising geopolitical tensions and shifts in trade policy have increased risks to Ireland’s financial system, the country’s regulator warned.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Fletcher

media:content.media:description: Gabriel Makhlouf Photographer: Paulo Nunes dos Santos/Bloomberg

item.title: NJ’s Sherrill, Ciattarelli Win Primaries in Governor’s Race
item.description: New Jersey voters chose US Representative Mikie Sherrill to face off against former state lawmaker Jack Ciattarelli, pitting a moderate Democrat against a Trump-endorsed Republican in the first gubernatorial election since last year’s presidential race.
item.dc:creator: Nacha Cattan, Sri Taylor

media:content.media:description: Jack Ciattarelli departs after casting his ballot during early voting in 2021.
